toronto-international-film-festival-tiff.name: Piers Handling
toronto-international-film-festival-tiff.bio: Led TIFF for over two decades, transforming it into one of the world's most prestigious film festivals.

toronto-international-film-festival-tiff.name: Cameron Bailey
toronto-international-film-festival-tiff.bio: Became CEO of TIFF in 2020 after serving as Artistic Director and co-head of the festival for many years.

toronto-international-film-festival-tiff.name: Lisa de Wilde
toronto-international-film-festival-tiff.bio: Served as Chair of the TIFF Board of Directors, guiding the organization's strategic direction and governance.

onex-corporation.name: Gerry Schwartz
onex-corporation.bio: Founded Onex Corporation in 1984 and built it into one of Canada's largest private equity firms.

onex-corporation.name: Bobby Le Blanc
onex-corporation.bio: Served as President of Onex and Managing Director of Onex Partners, overseeing major investment activities.

onex-corporation.name: Heather Reisman
onex-corporation.bio: CEO of Indigo Books and longtime Onex board member married to founder Gerry Schwartz.

shopify.name: Tobi Lütke
shopify.bio: Co-founded Shopify in 2006 and grew it into the leading global e-commerce platform powering millions of businesses.

shopify.name: Harley Finkelstein
shopify.bio: Became President of Shopify in 2020 after serving in multiple leadership roles since joining the company in 2010.

shopify.name: Daniel Weinand
shopify.bio: Co-founded Shopify alongside Tobi Lütke and shaped the platform's user experience and design philosophy.

bombardier-inc.name: Pierre Beaudoin
bombardier-inc.bio: Grandson of founder Joseph-Armand Bombardier who led the company as CEO and later served as Chairman of the Board.

bombardier-inc.name: Éric Martel
bombardier-inc.bio: Took over as CEO of Bombardier in 2020 to lead the company's transformation as a pure-play business aviation firm.

bombardier-inc.name: Laurent Beaudoin
bombardier-inc.bio: Son-in-law of the founder who led Bombardier for decades, expanding it into a global aerospace and transportation conglomerate.

reichmann-family-olympia-york.name: Paul Reichmann
reichmann-family-olympia-york.bio: The visionary leader of Olympia & York who spearheaded the development of Canary Wharf in London and the World Financial Center in New York.

reichmann-family-olympia-york.name: Albert Reichmann
reichmann-family-olympia-york.bio: Co-founded Olympia & York with his brothers and served as president overseeing the firm's vast real estate operations.

reichmann-family-olympia-york.name: Ralph Reichmann
reichmann-family-olympia-york.bio: The eldest Reichmann brother who helped establish the family's tile business before co-founding Olympia & York.

b-nai-brith-canada.name: Michael Mostyn
b-nai-brith-canada.bio: Served as CEO of B'nai Brith Canada, leading the organization's advocacy, anti-hate, and community engagement programs.

b-nai-brith-canada.name: Sam Katz
b-nai-brith-canada.bio: Served as National President of B'nai Brith Canada, guiding the organization's policy positions and community relations.

b-nai-brith-canada.name: David Matas
b-nai-brith-canada.bio: Prominent human rights lawyer who served as Senior Legal Counsel to B'nai Brith Canada for many years.

barrick-gold-peter-munk.name: Peter Munk
barrick-gold-peter-munk.bio: Hungarian-born Canadian businessman who founded Barrick Gold in 1983 and built it into the world's largest gold mining company.

barrick-gold-peter-munk.name: Mark Bristow
barrick-gold-peter-munk.bio: Became CEO of Barrick Gold following its 2019 merger with Randgold Resources, which he had previously led.

barrick-gold-peter-munk.name: John Thornton
barrick-gold-peter-munk.bio: Former Goldman Sachs executive who became Executive Chairman of Barrick Gold, driving the company's strategic transformation.

jewish-federations-of-canada-uia.name: Nikki Gershbain
jewish-federations-of-canada-uia.bio: Served as CEO of Jewish Federations of Canada-UIA, leading national coordination of Jewish community services and Israel engagement.

jewish-federations-of-canada-uia.name: Linda Frum
jewish-federations-of-canada-uia.bio: Canadian senator and journalist who served in key volunteer leadership roles supporting Jewish Federations of Canada-UIA fundraising.

jewish-federations-of-canada-uia.name: Jerry Silver
jewish-federations-of-canada-uia.bio: Served as National President of Jewish Federations of Canada-UIA guiding the organization's strategic priorities.

mount-sinai-hospital-toronto.name: Gary Newton
mount-sinai-hospital-toronto.bio: Led Mount Sinai Hospital as President and CEO, overseeing its integration into the Sinai Health System in Toronto.

mount-sinai-hospital-toronto.name: Zane Cohen
mount-sinai-hospital-toronto.bio: Renowned colorectal surgeon at Mount Sinai Hospital Toronto whose legacy includes the Zane Cohen Centre for Digestive Diseases.

mount-sinai-hospital-toronto.name: Joseph Mapa
mount-sinai-hospital-toronto.bio: Served as President and CEO of Mount Sinai Hospital for over a decade, overseeing major expansions and research initiatives.

federation-cja-montreal.name: Yair Szlak
federation-cja-montreal.bio: Led Federation CJA as President and CEO, overseeing the central fundraising and community planning body for Montreal's Jewish community.

federation-cja-montreal.name: Marc Gold
federation-cja-montreal.bio: Prominent Montreal lawyer and later Canadian senator who served as Chair of Federation CJA's board of directors.

federation-cja-montreal.name: Lillian Vineberg
federation-cja-montreal.bio: Led major fundraising campaigns for Federation CJA and was a prominent philanthropist in Montreal's Jewish community.

centre-for-israel-and-jewish-affairs-cij.name: Shimon Koffler Fogel
centre-for-israel-and-jewish-affairs-cij.bio: Served as CEO of CIJA, leading Canada's main advocacy organization for the Jewish community on domestic and international issues.

centre-for-israel-and-jewish-affairs-cij.name: David Cape
centre-for-israel-and-jewish-affairs-cij.bio: Served as Chair of CIJA's board, helping establish the organization as the unified advocacy voice for Canadian Jewry.

centre-for-israel-and-jewish-affairs-cij.name: Barbara Crook
centre-for-israel-and-jewish-affairs-cij.bio: Prominent Ottawa-based community leader who served in leadership roles at CIJA advocating for Jewish community interests.

canadian-museum-for-human-rights.name: Israel Asper
canadian-museum-for-human-rights.bio: Canadian media mogul and philanthropist whose vision and initial funding drove the creation of the Canadian Museum for Human Rights in Winnipeg.

canadian-museum-for-human-rights.name: Gail Asper
canadian-museum-for-human-rights.bio: Daughter of founder Israel Asper who led the fundraising campaign and continued championing the museum after her father's death.

canadian-museum-for-human-rights.name: John Young
canadian-museum-for-human-rights.bio: Served as President and CEO of the Canadian Museum for Human Rights, overseeing its operations and educational programming.

friends-of-simon-wiesenthal-center-canad.name: Avi Benlolo
friends-of-simon-wiesenthal-center-canad.bio: Led Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center for Holocaust Studies in Canada for nearly two decades as its founding President and CEO.

friends-of-simon-wiesenthal-center-canad.name: Michael Levitt
friends-of-simon-wiesenthal-center-canad.bio: Former Canadian MP who became President and CEO of Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center, continuing its Holocaust education and tolerance mission.

friends-of-simon-wiesenthal-center-canad.name: Honey Sherman
friends-of-simon-wiesenthal-center-canad.bio: Prominent Canadian philanthropist who was a major supporter and board member of Friends of Simon Wiesenthal Center.

munk-school-of-global-affairs-u-of-toron.name: Peter Munk
munk-school-of-global-affairs-u-of-toron.bio: Barrick Gold founder whose transformative donation to the University of Toronto established the Munk School of Global Affairs.

munk-school-of-global-affairs-u-of-toron.name: Janice Gross Stein
munk-school-of-global-affairs-u-of-toron.bio: Renowned political scientist who served as the founding director of the Munk School of Global Affairs at the University of Toronto.

munk-school-of-global-affairs-u-of-toron.name: Melanie Munk
munk-school-of-global-affairs-u-of-toron.bio: Daughter of Peter Munk who co-chairs the Peter and Melanie Munk Charitable Foundation supporting the school's mission.

canadian-jewish-congress-historical.name: Samuel Bronfman
canadian-jewish-congress-historical.bio: Seagram's founder who served as president of the Canadian Jewish Congress from 1939 to 1962, shaping Canadian Jewish community life.

canadian-jewish-congress-historical.name: Irving Abella
canadian-jewish-congress-historical.bio: Prominent Canadian historian and author of 'None Is Too Many' who served as national president of the Canadian Jewish Congress.

canadian-jewish-congress-historical.name: Alan Rose
canadian-jewish-congress-historical.bio: Served for decades as Executive Vice President of the Canadian Jewish Congress, managing its day-to-day advocacy and operations.

canaccord-genuity.name: Peter Brown
canaccord-genuity.bio: Vancouver financier who built Canaccord into a major independent investment dealer and served as its longtime chairman.

canaccord-genuity.name: Dan Daviau
canaccord-genuity.bio: Served as President and CEO of Canaccord Genuity Group, overseeing its global capital markets and wealth management operations.

canaccord-genuity.name: Stuart Raftus
canaccord-genuity.role: President of Canaccord Genuity Wealth Management
canaccord-genuity.bio: Led Canaccord Genuity's Canadian wealth management division, expanding its advisory services across the country.

uja-federation-of-greater-toronto.name: Adam Minsky
uja-federation-of-greater-toronto.bio: Served as President and CEO of UJA Federation of Greater Toronto, leading the largest Jewish fundraising organization in Canada.

uja-federation-of-greater-toronto.name: Larry Tanenbaum
uja-federation-of-greater-toronto.bio: Billionaire sports and business magnate who served as a major campaign leader and philanthropic supporter of UJA Federation.

uja-federation-of-greater-toronto.name: Julia Koschitzky
uja-federation-of-greater-toronto.bio: Leading Canadian Jewish philanthropist who chaired UJA Federation campaigns and held senior roles in global Jewish organizations.

montreal-holocaust-museum.name: Alice Herscovitch
montreal-holocaust-museum.bio: Served as Executive Director of the Montreal Holocaust Museum, overseeing its exhibitions, education programs, and survivor testimony archives.

montreal-holocaust-museum.name: Steven Cummings
montreal-holocaust-museum.bio: Montreal businessman who served as President of the Montreal Holocaust Museum's board of directors.

montreal-holocaust-museum.name: Muguette Myers
montreal-holocaust-museum.bio: French-born Holocaust survivor who became a key educator and spokesperson for the Montreal Holocaust Museum.

canadian-jewish-news.name: Yoni Goldstein
canadian-jewish-news.bio: Served as Editor-in-Chief of the Canadian Jewish News, guiding the publication's editorial direction and digital transformation.

canadian-jewish-news.name: Elizabeth Diament
canadian-jewish-news.bio: Served as Publisher of the Canadian Jewish News overseeing the business operations of Canada's leading Jewish newspaper.

canadian-jewish-news.name: Mordechai Ben-Dat
canadian-jewish-news.bio: Longtime senior journalist and editor at the Canadian Jewish News covering major stories in the Canadian Jewish community.

vancouver-holocaust-education-centre.name: Nina Krieger
vancouver-holocaust-education-centre.bio: Led the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre as Executive Director, expanding its educational reach across British Columbia.

vancouver-holocaust-education-centre.name: Robert Krell
vancouver-holocaust-education-centre.bio: Child Holocaust survivor and UBC psychiatry professor who co-founded the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre in 1983.

vancouver-holocaust-education-centre.name: Frieda Miller
vancouver-holocaust-education-centre.bio: Served as curator and program director of the Vancouver Holocaust Education Centre, developing its exhibitions and educational curricula.

toronto-hebrew-memorial-park.name: Lester Eckstein
toronto-hebrew-memorial-park.bio: Served as Executive Director of Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, overseeing operations of one of Canada's largest Jewish cemeteries.

toronto-hebrew-memorial-park.name: Benjamin Steiner
toronto-hebrew-memorial-park.bio: Served as President of the board of Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park, guiding the institution's governance and community outreach.

toronto-hebrew-memorial-park.name: Earl Berger
toronto-hebrew-memorial-park.bio: Longtime administrator at Toronto Hebrew Memorial Park who helped manage the cemetery's expansion and memorial services.

brookfield-asset-management.name: Bruce Flatt
brookfield-asset-management.bio: Transformed Brookfield Asset Management into one of the world's largest alternative asset managers with over $800 billion in assets.

brookfield-asset-management.name: Jack Cockwell
brookfield-asset-management.bio: South African-born financier who was a key architect of the Bronfman-controlled Edper/Brascan empire that evolved into Brookfield.

brookfield-asset-management.name: Brian Kingston
brookfield-asset-management.bio: Led Brookfield's global real estate business as CEO of Brookfield Property Group managing assets across major cities worldwide.

cirque-du-soleil.name: Guy Laliberté
cirque-du-soleil.bio: Founded Cirque du Soleil in 1984 as a former street performer and built it into the world's largest theatrical production company.

cirque-du-soleil.name: Daniel Lamarre
cirque-du-soleil.bio: Served as CEO of Cirque du Soleil for nearly two decades, expanding the brand globally with resident and touring shows.

cirque-du-soleil.name: Mitch Garber
cirque-du-soleil.bio: Canadian entrepreneur and business executive who served as Chairman of Cirque du Soleil's board after its acquisition.

saputo-inc.name: Lino Saputo Sr.
saputo-inc.bio: Italian-Canadian entrepreneur who founded Saputo in 1954 and grew it into one of the largest dairy processors in the world.

saputo-inc.name: Lino Saputo Jr.
saputo-inc.bio: Succeeded his father as CEO and later Chairman of Saputo Inc, continuing the company's global expansion strategy.

saputo-inc.name: Carl Colizza
saputo-inc.bio: Served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Saputo Inc, overseeing the company's day-to-day global operations.

canadian-friends-of-hebrew-university.name: Rami Kleinmann
canadian-friends-of-hebrew-university.bio: Served as CEO of Canadian Friends of Hebrew University, strengthening ties between Canadian donors and the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.

canadian-friends-of-hebrew-university.name: Gerald Schwartz
canadian-friends-of-hebrew-university.bio: Onex Corporation founder who served as honorary chair and prominent supporter of Canadian Friends of Hebrew University.

canadian-friends-of-hebrew-university.name: Jack Rabinovitch
canadian-friends-of-hebrew-university.bio: Canadian real estate developer and creator of the Scotiabank Giller Prize who was a key benefactor of CFHU.
